title.narrative: Agriculture Sector Programme Support, Phase II

description.narrative:
The second phase of the agriculture sector programme supports the Government of Bangladesh's goal of reducing poverty and improving the nutritional status through a more effective and sustainable food production and through building a well-functioning network of rural roads and market places.
The program aimed at improving the living conditions of the poorest small farmers and landless families. 0.7 million small farmers received support to develop their pond culture, livestock production, gardening and horticulture. 0.2 million small farmers received advice on integrated crop production. The program supports labour-intensive construction and upgraded of 1,390 km of rural roads. The majority of the labours were provided by poor women organized in labour contracting societies. A total of 3.10 million working days were created for the labour contracting societies.
The program comprised of three components:
1 - Agricultural Extension Component (AEC), dealt with field crops, gardening and horticulture anchored in the Ministry of Agriculture;
2 - Regional Fisheries & Livestock Development Component (RFLDC), dealt pond culture and livestock production anchored in the Ministry of Fisheries and Livestock and
3 - Rural Roads Market Access Component (RRMAC)dealt infrastructure such as rural roads and market places anchored in the Ministry of Local Government.
Under the agricultural extension component support is provided to the development efforts in the Chittagong Hill Tracts . These activities are conducted in close collaboration with UNDP.
The program was implemented in some of the poorest districts in the coastal areas, in poor districts in the north western part of the country and in three districts of the Chittagong Hill Tracts . There were program funds available for training, education and applied research. The Programme was on track, and expected results have been delivered on time.
